title: Quadrantids Meteor Shower
description: The Quadrantids is an above average shower, with up to 40 meteors per hour at its peak. Produced by dust grains from comet 2003 EH1. Best viewing from a dark location after midnight. Radiates from Bootes.

title: Venus at Greatest Eastern Elongation
description: Venus reaches 47.2° from the Sun. Highest point in western sky after sunset.

title: Full Moon - Wolf Moon
description: Fully illuminated at 22:28 UTC. Traditionally known as Wolf Moon.

title: Mars at Opposition
description: Closest approach to Earth, fully illuminated. Visible all night. Best viewing opportunity.

title: New Moon
description: Moon not visible (12:37 UTC). Optimal for observing faint celestial objects.

title: Full Moon - Snow Moon
description: Fully illuminated at 13:55 UTC. Traditionally known as Snow Moon.

title: New Moon
description: Moon not visible (00:46 UTC). Ideal for deep-sky observations.

title: Mercury at Greatest Eastern Elongation
description: 18.2° from Sun. Best evening visibility in western sky after sunset.

title: Full Moon - Worm Moon
description: Fully illuminated at 06:56 UTC. Marks spring soil softening.

title: Total Lunar Eclipse
description: Moon turns reddish during eclipse. Visible throughout the Americas.

title: March Equinox
description: Vernal equinox at 08:58 UTC. Equal day/night globally.

title: New Moon
description: Moon not visible (11:00 UTC). Optimal observation conditions.

title: Partial Solar Eclipse
description: Visible in Greenland, N. Europe, and N. Russia. 93% coverage in Canada.

title: Full Moon - Pink Moon
description: Fully illuminated at 00:24 UTC. Marks spring flower bloom.

title: Mercury at Greatest Western Elongation
description: 27.4° from Sun. Best morning visibility in eastern sky before sunrise.

title: Lyrids Meteor Shower
description: 20 meteors/hour from comet Thatcher. Radiates from Lyra. Best after midnight.

title: New Moon
description: Moon not visible (19:32 UTC). Prime galaxy viewing time.

title: Eta Aquarids Meteor Shower
description: Up to 60 meteors/hour (30 in N. Hemisphere) from Halley's Comet. Radiates from Aquarius.

title: Full Moon - Flower Moon
description: Fully illuminated at 16:57 UTC. Marks spring flower abundance.

title: New Moon
description: Moon not visible (03:04 UTC). Dark skies for observation.

title: Venus at Greatest Western Elongation
description: 45.9° from Sun. Best morning visibility in eastern sky before sunrise.

title: Full Moon - Strawberry Moon
description: Fully illuminated at 07:45 UTC. Marks strawberry harvesting season.

title: June Solstice
description: Summer solstice (Northern Hemisphere) at 02:40 UTC. Longest day of the year.

title: New Moon
description: Moon not visible (10:33 UTC). Ideal for deep-space observations.

title: Mercury at Greatest Eastern Elongation
description: 25.9° from Sun. Best evening visibility in western sky after sunset.

title: Full Moon - Buck Moon
description: Fully illuminated at 20:38 UTC. Marks deer antler growth period.

title: New Moon
description: Moon not visible (19:13 UTC). Optimal faint object viewing.

title: Delta Aquarids Meteor Shower
description: 20 meteors/hour from comets Marsden/Kracht. Radiates from Aquarius.

title: Full Moon - Sturgeon Moon
description: Fully illuminated at 07:56 UTC. Traditional fish harvest marker.

title: Perseids Meteor Shower
description: 60 meteors/hour from comet Swift-Tuttle. Radiates from Perseus.

title: Mercury at Greatest Western Elongation
description: 18.6° from Sun. Best morning visibility in eastern sky before sunrise.

title: New Moon
description: Moon not visible (06:08 UTC). Dark skies for observation.

title: Full Moon - Harvest Moon
description: Fully illuminated at 18:10 UTC. Closest to September equinox.

title: Total Lunar Eclipse
description: Blood Moon visible across Asia, Australia, and E. Europe/Africa.

title: New Moon
description: Moon not visible (19:55 UTC). Optimal observation conditions.

title: Partial Solar Eclipse
description: 76% coverage visible in New Zealand and Antarctica.

title: Saturn at Opposition
description: Brightest appearance. Visible all night with rings observable.

title: Neptune at Opposition
description: Closest approach to Earth. Appears as tiny blue dot in telescopes.

title: September Equinox
description: Autumnal equinox (Northern) at 18:17 UTC. Equal day/night globally.

title: Full Moon, Supermoon - Hunters Moon
description: First supermoon of 2025. Fully illuminated at 03:49 UTC.

title: Draconids Meteor Shower
description: 10 meteors/hour from comet 21P Giacobini-Zinner. Early evening viewing.

title: New Moon
description: Moon not visible (12:26 UTC). Optimal galaxy observation conditions.

title: Orionids Meteor Shower
description: 20 meteors/hour from Halley's Comet. Dark skies due to new moon. Radiates from Orion.

title: Mercury at Greatest Eastern Elongation
description: 23.9° from Sun. Best evening visibility in western sky after sunset.

title: Taurids Meteor Shower
description: 5-10 meteors/hour from asteroid/comet debris. Bright moon interference expected.

title: Full Moon, Supermoon - Beaver Moon
description: Second supermoon of 2025. Fully illuminated at 13:21 UTC.

title: Leonids Meteor Shower
description: 15 meteors/hour from comet Tempel-Tuttle. Dark skies for optimal viewing.

title: New Moon
description: Moon not visible (06:49 UTC). Prime deep-sky observation window.

title: Uranus at Opposition
description: Closest approach to Earth. Visible as blue-green dot through telescopes.

title: Full Moon, Supermoon - Cold Moon
description: Third supermoon of 2025. Fully illuminated at 23:15 UTC.

title: Mercury at Greatest Western Elongation
description: 20.7° from Sun. Best morning visibility in eastern sky before sunrise.

title: Geminids Meteor Shower
description: 120 meteors/hour from asteroid Phaethon. Moon may obscure faint meteors.

title: New Moon
description: Moon not visible (01:45 UTC). Best time for faint object observations.

title: December Solstice
description: Winter solstice (Northern) at 15:02 UTC. Shortest day of the year.

title: Ursids Meteor Shower
description: 5-10 meteors/hour from comet Tuttle. Dark skies post-moonset.
